div.style: background: url('https://www.esciencecenter.nl/img/main/p56-large.jpg') no-repeat center center; background-size: cover;

div.p: Have a look at the latest additions to our project portfolio

The Netherlands eScience Center (NLeSC) is the national hub for the development and application of domain overarching software and methods for the scientific community. NLeSC is a joint initiative of the Dutch national research council (NWO) and the Dutch organisation for ICT in education and research (SURF).

a.h3: Software Sustainability at the Heart of Discovery

div.p: Behoud en toekomstgerichte (her-)bruikbaarheid van software neemt snel in belang toe nu, mede wegens het toenemende belang van accountability in de wetenschap, data-transparantie belangrijker wordt en zonder software geen data gelezen, begrepen of gebruikt kunnen worden.

a.blockquote: “Point clouds give users a lot of detailed information on objects and their whereabouts”

div.p: Jisk Attema, Maarten van Meersbergen & Oscar Martinez-Rubi

​One of our goals is to actively contribute to and promote re-use of scientific software. For this reason we have joined the OpenDA association. OpenDA wants to stimulate the use of data-assimilation and calibration by lowering the implementation costs and enhancing the exchange of software among researchers and end-users.

div.div: Detecting Anomalous Behavior in Stadium Crowds

a.blockquote: “In onze samenwerking streven we steeds naar breed inzetbare resultaten, want dan heeft het echt impact ”

div.p: Sylvia Kuijpers (SURFnet), Walter Lioen (SURFsara) en Frank Seinstra (Netherlands eScience Center)

Our path-finding project Mapping the Via Appia featured at the Dutch National Science Agenda`s Eureka Festival last November. GIS Magazine published a nice article (in Dutch) on the achievements of the project.

div.div: Massive Biological Data Clustering, Reporting and Visualization Tools

div.p:
Netherlands eScience Center
Science Park 140 (Matrix I)
1098 XG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
